fields.Title: Helen - EasterEggs / Something washes ashore / Flow – INVENTORY / LEOPARD-PATTERNED BODYSUIT

fields.Dialogue Text: But don't you *want* to feel different? It can be a *secret* that only you know.
Not worth the risk. [Discard item.]
Yes, *this* is the type of animal I want to be.
What should I... *do* with it?! (Continue.)
Your fingers run down your pectoral muscles, your abdominals, your hips -- it's impossible to tell where you end and the leopard begins.
Feel the material between your fingers.
[Rip it off!]
Again: once the leopard comes on, it's never *ever* coming off.
It's on *very* tight. You might rip it if you take it off now.
The dried sea salt chafes against your soft flesh.
This is a men's size L leopard-patterned unitard with short sleeves. There are bits of seaweed stuck to it. It speaks to the animal inside you.

fields.annotation_text:
LEOPARD-PATTERNED BODYSUIT
This leopard-patterned garment washed up on the coast and is still sporting bits of seaweed stuck to its fabric. It looks dangerously feral.

fields.Dialogue Text: Get this thing off me!
Can't you feel the hairs on your arm and on the back of your neck standing up? Your heart rate's through the roof, your pupils are the size of marbles. This is *irreversible peril*!

fields.annotation_text:
It's like diving into a warm lake.

Slipping into the garment feels like stepping into a lake on a warm summer eve -- the silky warmth engulfs you. It's tight, reassuring, electrifying.

fields.Dialogue Text: Try it on -- but only for a moment.
It's wearing you now.
Slow and steady, boy. You know how to handle this.
Yeah, but why does it *taste* so sweet?
Just know that once the leotard goes on, it never comes off. *You* will change, irrevocably.

The Greidian Irbis -- or common snow leopard -- is native to the Ohota mountains in Graad. Weighing up to 85kg, it is the apex predator of its ecosystem, though extensive poaching and habitat destruction have reduced its range significantly in the last 40 years.
Despite the time it's spent in the water, the garment itself is surprisingly silky. The leopard spots are slightly textured. The garment label says it's composed of 85% polyamide and 15% elastane.
Put it away. [Leave.]
You slip from your briefs into the leotard. It's very tight. You've never been cradled so firmly before.
Where did it come from?
[Leave it on forever.]
Run, you idiot!
Something else is in charge now.
Wait, am I in danger?
There, along the inside shoulder seam, you see the words: No Truce (TM), made in Igaunija. This must be the brand.
You tear yourself free from the leotard and hurl the crumpled mass into the corner. It's someone else's problem now.
There's only one thing left to do -- see how it fits.
You crumple the leotard up into a small ball and place it discreetly in the corner. It's someone else's problem now.
The wind blows through rocks and reeds. Days spent in the saltwater have washed off any clues of its origin.
Who cares, it's a tard-suit either way.
Drop it now! This thing will *eat* you.
Putting on the garment feels like stepping into a warm summer lake -- the silky warmth engulfs you.
Actually, this is a *leotard*, not a unitard. Unitards have legs.
